{{cleanup-linkrot|date=August 2011}} {{Infobox album | | Name = Winter Songs | Type = studio | Artist = [[Ronan Keating]] | Cover = wintersongsronan.jpg | Released = November 16, 2009 | Recorded = 2009 | Genre = [[Pop music|Pop]] | Length = 41:15 | Label = [[Polydor Records]] | Producer = [[Stephen Lipson]] | Last album = ''[[Songs for My Mother]]''
(2009) | This album = '''''Winter Songs'''''
(2009) | Next album = ''[[Duet (Ronan Keating album)|Duet]]''
(2010) | Misc = {{Singles | Name = Winter Songs | Type = studio | single 1 = [[Stay (Sugarland song)#Cover versions|Stay]] | single 1 date = November 16, 2009 | single 2 = It's Only Christmas | single 2 date = December 11, 2009 }} }} '''''Winter Songs''''' (in Australia and New Zealand titled '''''Stay''''')[http://www.discogs.com/Ronan-Keating-Stay/release/2075206 Ronan Keating - Stay (CD, Album - Australia) at Discogs] is the sixth [[studio album]] released by [[Ireland|Irish]] singer/songwriter and [[Boyzone]] frontman [[Ronan Keating]]. It was released by [[Polydor Records]] on November 16, 2009 in the [[United Kingdom|UK]] and [[Ireland]], debuting at number 16 and 12 in each respective album chart. The first single, a cover of [[Grammy Award]]-winning American [[country music]] duo [[Sugarland]]'s hit "[[Stay (Sugarland song)|Stay]]", was released digitally on the same day. ==Album information== The album ''Winter Songs'' follows the [[United Kingdom|UK]] [[List of number-one albums (UK)|number one album]] ''[[Songs for My Mother]]'' released six months earlier, this time pulling together a set of 11 songs that evoke special memories of winter and Christmas for [[Ronan Keating]].[http://www.umusic.co.uk/News/NewsItem.aspx?id=615 Universal Music UK News][http://hmv.com/hmvweb/displayProductDetails.do?ctx=220;1;4;90;-1&sku=280034 hmv.com: music: Winter Songs (2009)] ''Winter Songs'' includes traditional Christmas classics such as "[[Silent Night]]" and "[[Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas]]" as well as modern festive classics like [[Joni Mitchell]]'s [[River (Joni Mitchell song)|River]] and [[Sugarland]]'s "[[Stay (Sugarland song)|Stay]]". Songs originally performed by artists like [[Simon & Garfunkel]] ("[[Homeward Bound (song)|Homeward Bound]]") and [[Bob Dylan]] ("Ring Them Bells") are also included on the album, which also includes two brand new Ronan Keating songs "It's Only Christmas" and "Scars". Like Keating's previous album, ''Winter Songs'' is produced by [[Stephen Lipson]] ([[Paul McCartney]], [[Annie Lennox]] and [[Pet Shop Boys]]). The album also features the last studio recording of [[Stephen Gately]], who died a short while after the album was completed.[http://primetime.unrealitytv.co.uk/stephen-gatelys-last-song-was-the-little-drummer-boy-with-ronan-keating/ Stephen Gately's last song was The Little Drummer Boy] Ronan told The News Of The World: âWhat keeps me going is that Stephen is on this album. His vocal on Little Drummer Boy is one of the most beautiful recordings. He is almost angelic â which is truly fitting as I believe my friend is an angel now.â In a press release about the album, Keating said that "some of these songs conjure up some of my favorite Christmas memories". ==Track listing== # "Winter Song" (Sara Bareilles/Ingrid Michaelson) # "Stay" (Jennifer Nettles) # "Scars" (Steve McEwan/John White) # "Homeward Bound" (Paul Simon) # "River" (Joni Mitchell) # "It's Only Christmas" (Ronan Keating/Paul Barry) # "Little Drummer Boy" (Katherine Davis/Henry Onorati/Harry Simeone) # "Ring Them Bells" (Bob Dylan) # "Caledonia" (Fleecy Moore) # "Silent Night" (Franz Gruber) # "Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas" (Ralph Blane/Hugh Martin) # "I Won't Last a Day Without You" (Paul Williams/Roger Nichols) ==Chart== {| class="wikitable" !align="left"|Chart (2009) !align="left"|Peak
position !align="left"|Certification !align="left"|Sales/
shipments |- |align="left"|[[ARIA Charts|Australian Albums Chart]] |align="center"| 24 |align="center"| |align="center"| |- |align="left"|[[Irish Albums Chart]] |align="center"|12 |align="center"| |align="center"| |- |[[Recording Industry Association of New Zealand|New Zealand Albums Chart]] |align="center"|25 |align="center"| |align="center"| |- |align="left"|[[UK Albums Chart]] |align="center"|16 |align="center"| |align="center"| |- |align="left"|[[German Albums Chart]]http://www.musicline.de/de/chartverfolgung_summary/artist/KEATING%2CRONAN/?type=longplay |align="center"|73 |align="center"| |align="center"| |- |} ==References== {{reflist}} {{Ronan Keating}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Winter Songs (Ronan Keating Album)}} [[Category:2009 albums]] [[Category:Ronan Keating albums]] [[it:Winter Songs (Ronan Keating)]]
